ngiemboon: É cʉa lyɛ̌ʼ sétá, atsɔ́ lɔ́ɔnndá gwɔ́ tÿǒsoŋo Kánà, á tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Ngalílîa, má pà Yěsô gwɔ́ wó.
en: On the third day a wedding took place in Cana   of Galilee.  # 2:1 Mt 17:22 Jesus’s mother  # 2:1 Mt 1:16 was there,

ngiemboon: Mé gíŋ ńtóŋo Yěsô yé pâ megàŋakwò pé, á jʉʼʉ lɔ́ɔnndá ŋwɛ́.
en: and Jesus and his disciples were invited to the wedding as well.

ngiemboon: Melùʼ gÿo ḿmag, má pà Yěsô gɔɔn né yé ngie: «Epʉ̀a té gíŋ ńgẅiin melùʼ mie pɔ́ ge nú wɔ́.»
en: When the wine ran out, Jesus’s mother told him, “They don’t have any wine.”

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó yé ngie: «Má wɔ̀ɔn, ɔ̀ kẅé kɔ́ mbwó mèŋ? À yɔ́ɔn fʉ̀ʼ nyé te kuʼ.»
en: “What has this concern of yours to do with me,   ,# 2:4 2Sm 16:10; 19:22 woman? ”   # 2:4 Jn 19:26 Jesus asked. “My hour has not yet come.”

ngiemboon: Má we gʉa ńgɔɔn né palye pʉ̀a ngie: «À lɔɔn ńgɔɔn ngie pi gÿo pɔ́ kɔ́ wɔ́ɔ, pi gÿo.»
en: “Do whatever he tells you,” his mother told the servants.

ngiemboon: Etsɔ́ mekʉŋ tóon gwɔ́ jʉʼó ntɔgɔ́. Pa Yúndà kúu ntse tsoló ńdɔgɔ sɔgɔ pʉ̀ tá ńguʼte Ssé páʼ lepʉ̌ láʼ sɔ́b la ne ńzɛ́te. É la gwɔ́ tà ńgwɔ́ gie ngwɔ́ mé néŋ ntse tsoon lítà nkÿo tsɛ̀ɛ tàʼ.
en: Now six stone water jars had been set there for Jewish purification.   Each contained twenty or thirty gallons.  # 2:6 Lit two or three measures

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né palye pʉ̀a ngie: «Pi néŋ ntse tsɛ̀ɛ mekʉŋ ŋwɛ́ tà é lúe.» Pɔ́ néŋ ntse tsoló tà é lúe.
en: “Fill the jars with water,” Jesus told them. So they filled them to the brim.

ngiemboon: Yěsô leen ńké ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: «Pi kú tsɔ́ fʉ̀ʼɔɔn, ńgʉa ńnáa mbwó nyìŋ gẅie à taŋté línɔ̀ɔn.» Pɔ́ kú ńgʉa ńná né yé.
en: Then he said to them, “Now draw some out and take it to the headwaiter.”    And they did.

ngiemboon: Á zẅíʼ ntse gẅie é selé ńcʉ́ʼ melùʼ, à te ne ńzsé jʉʼ gie mɛ̌ melùʼ fóo wó wɔ́, tá palye pʉ̀a pie é ně ńtúʼ ntse, é ne ńzsé. Nyìŋ gẅie à taŋté línɔ̀ɔn, á tóŋo nyìŋ gẅie mé gÿo lɔ́ɔnndá yé,
en: When the headwaiter tasted the water (after it had become wine), he did not know where it came from #— #though the servants who had drawn the water knew. He called the groom

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: «Mé ée ḿvɔgɔ ńnáa pɔ́ melùʼ mbòŋo, tà mé núu tɛʼ, tá mé náa mie é náʼa ḿmeen meen. Táʼ, ńgʉa na gù, mbà yɔɔn áa jú fʉ̀ʼ gie ɔ̀ náa melùʼ mbòŋo mbwó pʉ̀a lá?»
en: and told him, “Everyone sets out the fine wine first, then, after people are drunk, the inferior. But you have kept the fine wine until now.”

ngiemboon: Wɔɔn aa páʼ Yěsô la zye légÿo menò mɔɔnmɔɔn púʼu. Á laa Kánà, á tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Ngalílîa, Yěsô lɔg púʼu, ńdaʼte legúʼ we. Megàŋakwò pé záb ntʉ́m na yé.
en: Jesus did this, the first of his signs, in Cana   of Galilee.  # 2:11 Mt 17:22 He revealed  # 2:11 2Co 4:11; 1Jn 1:2 his glory,  # 2:11 Mk 10:37; Jn 17:24 and his disciples believed in him.

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn nò tɔ́g, Yěsô pâ má we, lâ mefɛ̌ pé, ńgÿo megàŋakwò pé gʉa né tÿǒsoŋo Kapɛ́ɛnàwum, ńkúu wó, ńnéŋe pɔ́ lyɛ̌ʼ shÿɔ́ʼɔ tsɔ́ wɔ́ɔ.
en: After this, he went down to Capernaum,   together with his mother, his brothers,  # 2:12 Mt 12:46–50; Mk 3:31–35; 6:3; Lk 8:19–21; Ac 1:14 and his disciples, and they stayed there only a few days.

ngiemboon: Alínɔ̀ɔn pásékà pà Yúndà la ne ḿbɔ́ɔnte, Yěsô leen ńké ḿbʉ né Yelúzálèm,
en: The Jewish Passover   was near, and so Jesus went up to Jerusalem.  # 2:13 Mt 23:37

ngiemboon: ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ ndá Ssé, ńgyá epʉ̀a gwɔ́ tsoló ńne sẅiŋe mefòŋ, petsɔ́ ne sẅiŋe menjʉ̀njÿò, petsɔ́ ne sẅiŋe mekàpʉ̀ŋ, mbɔɔ pakúbe nkáb néŋte ssé.
en: In the temple   he found people selling oxen, sheep, and doves, and he also found the money changers sitting there.

ngiemboon: Yěsô leen ńké ńdɔg menkÿo ńcwoŋte ngwɔɔn, éfó tsɛ̀ɛ ndá Ssé, ńjwoŋ pʉ̀a apɛ̌ lâ menjʉ̀njÿò mɔ́b, lâ mefòŋ, ńtsó metápèle ńgwáʼ, nkáb pʉ́le ssé,
en: After making a whip out of cords,   he drove everyone out of the temple with their sheep  # 2:15 Mt 7:15 and oxen. He also poured out the money changers’ coins and overturned the tables.

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn mbwó pasẅiŋ mekàpʉ̀ŋ ngie: «Pi lɔg shúm sɛ̂ éfó jʉʼɔɔn ńgʉa! Pi pɔ́ɔn lélɔgɔ jʉʼʉ Tá wɔ̀ɔn ńgÿo jʉʼʉ metʉ̌a.»
en: He told those who were selling doves, “Get these things out of here! Stop turning my Father’s    house   # 2:16 Lk 11:51; Jn 2:17 into a marketplace! ”   # 2:16 Lit a house of business,# 2:16 Jr 7:11; Zch 14:21; Mal 3:1–3

ngiemboon: Megàŋakwò Yěsô leen ńké ńkímte jʉʼʉ Ŋwàʼne Ssé gie á gɔɔn ngie: «N kwoŋo jʉʼ jú kwoŋ tà n ge láʼ kwé pɔ́ mǒ.»
en: And his disciples remembered that it is written: Zeal    for your house will consume   # 2:17 Gl 5:15 me.   # 2:17 Ps 69:9,# 2:17 Ps 69:9

ngiemboon: Pasáʼa láʼa pà Yúndà leen ńké ńgɔɔn né Yěsô ngie: «Gÿo ndàagyá nò mvfò peg, ńdɔg ńnyɛɛ wég ngie mé la náa gú tʉ̀ légÿo mmó gie ɔ̀ gÿo lɛ̂.»
en: So the Jews replied to him, “What sign will you show us for doing these things? ”

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó pɔ́b ngie: «Pi keme jʉʼʉ ssé yɔɔn, n dɔg lyɛ̌ʼ sétá, ḿbʉʼʉ ńtÿɔ́g tÿɔ́g.»
en: Jesus answered, “Destroy this temple,   ,# 2:19 Lk 1:21 and I will raise it up in three days.”   # 2:19 Lk 9:22

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gɔɔn né yé ngie: «Mé la lɔg ngùʼ ntsɔ̀b ntɔgɔ́ né móm lekùɔ, ńkwɛ́ɛ jʉʼʉ Ssé yɔɔn, ńgʉa na gù, mbà ɔ̀ gɔ̌ɔn ngie ngwɔ́ ɔ̀ lɔg lyɛ̌ʼ sétá ḿbʉʼʉ ńtÿɔ́g lá?»
en: Therefore the Jews said, “This temple took forty-six years to build,   and will you raise it up in three days? ”  # 2:20 Mk 15:29

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn páʼɔɔn, ajʉʼʉ Ssé gie à kime, é gwɔ́ pɔ́ mbùm ye.
en: But he was speaking about the temple of his body.

ngiemboon: Áa yɛ̌ tá à la gÿo ńzíme na legwé, megàŋakwò pé kímte ngie à la gɔɔn yɔɔn nò, ńdeen ńké ńzẅíŋ, ńgíŋ ńzẅíŋe gie Ŋwàʼne Ssé la gɔɔn na Yěsô.
en: So when he was raised from the dead,   his disciples remembered that he had said this,  # 2:22 Jn 14:26 and they believed the Scripture  # 2:22 Mt 26:54; 2Pt 1:20 and the statement Jesus had made.

ngiemboon: Yěsô nyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ Yelúzálèm, mé ne ńjÿó línɔ̀ɔn pásékà, aláʼ gyá menò mɔɔnmɔɔn mie à ne ńgÿo, epʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn záb ntʉ́m na yé.
en: While he was in Jerusalem   during the Passover Festival,  # 2:23 Jn 5:1 many believed in his name  # 2:23 Jn 10:25; 1Jn 3:23 when they saw the signs he was doing.

ngiemboon: Táʼ, Yěsô te gwáʼ mbùm ye mbwó pɔ́b wɔ́, mélàʼmie à la ne ńzsé páʼ pɔ́ metsèm gwɔ́.
en: Jesus, however, would not entrust himself to them, since he knew them all

ngiemboon: À la te ne ńtsɔ́ɔn ngie mé kyagte kyagte éshwóŋo yé wɔ́. Kwàʼ yé lé twó yé, à zsé mmó gie áa tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m nyìŋ mesoŋ.
en: and because he did not need anyone to testify about man; for he himself knew what was in man.
